attributes.action: Demand that Taxpayers money is no longer spent on hotels for Asylum Seekers.
attributes.background: As Taxpayers we want this money spent on the homeless and OAP's that need this money and support far more than those who come here by boat trying to shortcircuit the immigration system.
attributes.additional_details: We have over 200,000 homeless people on our streets and thousands of OAP's that can no longer afford to pay their energy bills and eat three healthy meals per day. This money needs to be spent on those in desperate situations, those who have paid into the system all their lives or have been evicted from their homes due to loss of jobs and the cost of living crisis.

rejection.details:
We understand that you are concerned about existing arrangements for housing asylum seekers, but we're not sure how you want asylum seekers to be housed.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, we could accept a petition calling on the Government to build new purpose-built facilities for housing asylum seekers, if that's something you want to happen.

attributes.action: To legislate for new homes to have compulsory photovoltaic panel installation
attributes.background: To make sure new homes are built with photovoltaic panels able to cover to some degree the energy requirements of the household
attributes.additional_details: Because it’s the right action for the environment and because the UK needs to explore avenues of energy autonomy because of social and national security reasons

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617573

attributes.action: Stop energy companies profiteering from war
attributes.background: Cap fuel prices. The energy companies are showing record profits while many families are struggling now even before the rises. These profits have been inflated by the war between Russia and Ukraine so does this not constitute profiteering from war? Does the government not recognise it as this?
attributes.additional_details: Families are struggling and rather than the government having to find ways to help them via money contributions out of our own funds would it not make sense to cap the profits of the companies and therefore keep the bills low? If the profits of the companies were capped to their expected levels pre the war then they would be getting what they expected rather than the expanded version they are now enjoying due to war.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about profits of energy companies, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Remove powers from Ofgem & replace with a regulatory body that’s fit for purpose
attributes.background: Remove a body that’s not fit for purpose and will cripple our country inadvertently pushing us into a 3rd world state.  The energy caps are perverse and the reverse of what a price cap is considering the profit levels of the energy provider owners like Centrica/Shell
attributes.additional_details:
Solar and green power options should be a choice and not forced on us all. It is a pointless act whilst you have industries chugging out greenhouse gases in economies like China and India. 
Until a global change is agreed on the current net zero policy is a virtue signalling death-knell to many of us regardless of our income levels.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want Ofgem to be replaced, but it's not clear what you want to be different about a new energy regulator.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Temporary 2% income tax increase to fund energy bill support for less well off
attributes.background: We want an emergency, time-limited increase in income tax to fund energy bill support for those earning below the average UK income, or on benefits, to help them pay their energy bills.
attributes.additional_details: To ease the worst effects on the less well off in our society of the prolonged energy and cost of living crises.

attributes.action: Rather than subsidies Utility companies profits, renationalise them
attributes.background:
Take utilities companies back under public ownership to stop the exploitation of bill payers by extortionate price increases at the tax payers expenses.

Privatised utility companies have paid out billions to shareholders while neglecting the infrastructure investments required
attributes.additional_details:
More people will be thrown into fuel poverty with the predicted rises due to come, while energy, oil and gas companies are making more profits than ever before.

Tax payers money should not be used to subsidies these profits while people are struggling to pay theirs.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621658

attributes.action: Stop Energy companies from raising the 'Standing Charge' & ask them to lower it!
attributes.background: Standing Charge has risen exponentially which has nothing to do with the wholesale of energy. They are forcing customers to pay 80% more even if we don't use energy or gas. This is a scam! Stop energy companies from ripping off the British people! Force them to REDUCE the 'Standing Charge'
attributes.additional_details: Energy Companies are scamming the British people with the unjustified increase in the Standing Charge. It has nothing to do with the wholesale of energy and now we pay twice regardless of the electricity and gas that we consume. It's a shame!

rejection.details: Decisions about standing charges are a matter for utility providers and Ofgem, not the UK Government or Parliament. The price cap is a cap on a unit of gas and electricity, with standing charges taken into account. Find out more about the energy price cap, including how it includes standing charges, here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you

attributes.action: Apply cost control to energy providers
attributes.background: Energy companies are increasing costs to customers with very little control applied, whilst still reaping ever increasing profits. This is leading to fuel poverty for many people in the country, and affecting everyone's standard of living.
attributes.additional_details: Cap energy provider profits, so that if they exceed, anything remaining will be recirculated to reduce consumer costs

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the cost of energy, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

An energy price cap already applies to energy customers on their supplier's basic energy tariff, to stop energy companies from making excessive profits and ensure customers pay a fair price for their energy. You can find out more about how this works here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/information-consumers/energy-advice-households/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Do Not Raise The Energy Price Cap
attributes.background: The Energy Price Cap (Gas & Electricity) is due to rise again on 1st October 2022, by an estimated 42% (Source: OFGEM 24.05.22). This will push millions of people into fuel poverty. Another price cap rise in 2022 is completely unjustified, especially when we are facing a cost of living crisis.
attributes.additional_details: The public are already paying the highest price in history, for their domestic gas and electricity. Raising the energy price cap again this October will force the elderly and those on lower incomes to choose between heating their homes, or putting food on the table. This is totally unacceptable, and OFGEM cannot justify raising the price cap any further in 2022. The large ‘big six’ energy companies are reporting record profits in the region of billions of pounds, so a rise is wholly unjustified.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The energy cap is set by Ofgem, which is operationally independent of the Government and Parliament.

You might like to sign the following petitions, which call for related actions:

Subsidise energy prices to offset any increase in the energy price cap
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/606586

Temporarily suspend all taxes on all fuels and energy bills
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610585

Subsidise a 'basic' amount of electricity for households
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616915

attributes.action: Force ofgem to abolish all standing charges on gas and electricity
attributes.background: We the people have been effectively cast aside during the cost of living crisis. The cost of food and bills have skyrocketed none more so than the cost of energy a typical user will see £300 a year in standing charges added to their bills that before the privilege of even using it We are calling on
attributes.additional_details: the government to force ofgem to scrap all standing charges on energy bills while the crisis is ongoing and order a review into the abolition of standing charges, it is an unfair poll tax on the people of this country and we deserve a energy sector that looks out for the consumers and not the directors and their interests.

rejection.details:
Decisions about standing charges are a matter for utility providers and Ofgem, not the UK Government or Parliament.

The price cap is a cap on a unit of gas and electricity, with standing charges taken into account. Find out more about the energy price cap, including how it includes standing charges, here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you

attributes.action: Lower the amount of tax on fuel!
attributes.background: The amount of tax customers pay on fuel is unsustainable, the speed in which price increases are on the rise on top of other energy bills is going to hurt nearly every family out there.
attributes.additional_details: Reduce the amount of tax paid on fuel at the pump.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Reduce fuel duty and VAT by 40% for a period of 2 years: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599089

Stop charging VAT on fuel duty: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599411

Temporarily suspend all taxes on all fuels and energy bills: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610585

Suspend VAT on road fuels to reduce fuel costs: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610567

attributes.action: Change the pricing of Renewable Energy so that it is no longer set by Gas Prices
attributes.background: The Government & Parliament should reconsider the pricing mechanism for Renewable Energy in the UK. Electricity generators usually have contracts which tie their price to the “market”, which usually is set by gas. This is horribly outdated and we need to see it changed to encourage green energy.
attributes.additional_details: We are a family of three living in South Devon. We don't want our young daughter's life to be horribly affected by climate change. We signed up to a 100% renewable electricity scheme in 2020 through Octopus Energy. We were happy to pay a premium for this renewable supply of energy over the fossil fuel rate because we believe in leading through positive action. We strongly believe that renewable energy consumers should not be punished by increasing gas prices, as has been the case for our family.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about the increased cost of energy, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The energy price cap is backstop protection from the government for people who default onto their supplier's basic energy tariff. Ofgem calculates the cap level that suppliers must apply to these tariffs. The cap does not apply to customers that have chosen a standard variable green energy tariff Ofgem has exempted from the cap. For customers on a standard variable green energy tariff it is up to individual energy providers what to charge.

You can find out more about the energy price cap here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/information-consumers/energy-advice-households/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you

attributes.action: create a separate price cap for renewable energy, specifically Heat Pumps!
attributes.background: Get the Government to create a separate price cap for renewable energy specifically Air Source and Ground Source Heat Pumps! This will create a lower Price for KW hours and encourage more people to adopt this technology
attributes.additional_details:
This action by the government will ensure that consumers pay less by adopting ground source (geothermal) and air source heat pump which will encourage more people to adopt these technologie!
This will significantly help the government meet its 600,000 heat pumps per year!

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want the Government to encourage the uptake of renewable energy, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. If a household installs a heat pump then they will pay for the energy needed to power the pump, but won't have to pay anything for the heat generated by the pump.

There is a Domestic Renewable Heat Incentive (RHI), which can be claimed for certain heat pumps: https://www.gov.uk/domestic-renewable-heat-incentive

If you want the Government to expand incentives to install heat pumps, we could accept a petition requesting this, but it would need to be clear what incentives you wanted the Government to offer.

attributes.action: Put the cap back on energy companies and don't send people into poverty
attributes.background: Taking the cap of energy companies so they can raise there prices will only send deprived areas and families into poverty, people are already struggling after the effects of the Covid-19 pandemic. People have lost businesses and homes. The price of living is already high enough
attributes.additional_details: Don't let big energy companies take advantage and be greedy enough to send people into poverty by raising prices. As a government use have a duty of care but being greedy and sending people into poverty, becoming homeless people are barely getting by as it is and raising prices of energy bills by over 50% is an evil act of power

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.  The Energy Price Cap remains in force, but is set by Ofgem and not the UK Government or Parliament.  You can find out more here

https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you

attributes.action: Label protein content on all food packaging
attributes.background:
all food packaging has calories, fats, saturates, sugar and salt but not protein.

Protein is the most important energy resource we have available and to not have the contents visible makes more room for confusion.
attributes.additional_details: Protein is the most important energy source and we need to place more importance on this and by displaying the protein percentage on all food packaging will educate more people and lead a healthier life

rejection.details:
Businesses selling food and drink products are already required to include a declaration of nutrition content on labelling, including the amounts (in grams (g)) of fat, saturates, carbohydrate, sugars, protein and salt.

You can read more about food labelling and packaging
requirements here: https://www.gov.uk/food-labelling-and-packaging

The technical guidance on nutrition labelling is available here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/technical-guidance-on-nutrition-labelling

attributes.action: Provide global climate leadership by ending any new UK oil and gas extraction
attributes.background: Greenhouse gas emissions from fossil fuel burning are choking our planet and putting billions of people at immediate risk. But the UK Government plans to allow new oil and gas fields to start up between now and 2050. The UK Government must change policy and stop any new UK oil and gas extraction.
attributes.additional_details:
The viability of our societies depends on limiting global temperature rise to 1.5°C above the pre-industrial era average. It has already risen 1.1°C. 

Without deep carbon and methane pollution cuts (from burning fossil fuels) between now and 2030, the 1.5°C goal is unachievable. 

The UK Government must show global climate leadership by ending any new oil and gas extraction and announce support for a rapid expansion of renewable energy and a plan for increasing energy efficiency of UK homes.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/594797

attributes.action: Abolish Standing Energy Charges
attributes.background: Abolish the Standing Energy Charge for all UK residences. These charges apply 365 days a year, regardless of energy supplied.
attributes.additional_details:
Current standing charges for energy vary by region but can cost on average each household £200+ a year.  This remains even if no energy is supplied.  This is appears unjust and it’s removal would provide many families additional relief from increasing costs.  

https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you

https://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/bills/article-11031939/amp/Scrap-energy-standing-charges-prevent-fuel-poverty-says-charity.html

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621561

attributes.action: Take back privatisation of energy & services back in to public hands
attributes.background: Pull your dirty fingers out of the pies and put these companies back in to publics hands rather than stakeholders
attributes.additional_details: Government are allowing this the government have the power to stop this

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621537

attributes.action: Introduce a cap on profits made by energy companies.
attributes.background: There needs to be a cap on how much profit energy companies can make.
attributes.additional_details: Right now people are struggling to pay their ever rising energy bills, meanwhile energy companies are reporting record profits. It's disgraceful that they are allowed to make so much money from people who are struggling to make ends meet.

rejection.details:
We understand that you are concerned about the profits that some companies are making and the impact of high costs on people. However, we're not exactly sure how you'd want a cap on profits to work, or what that cap should be. 

You could start a new petition explaining what you'd like to happen. For example, you could start a petition asking the UK Government to increase its current energy profits tax to a certain level, if that's something that you'd like to see.

You may also wish to sign this petition calling for energy companies to be nationalised: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621719 or this petition calling for a not-for-profit state owned energy provider to be created: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617446

You may be interested to know that the current energy price cap sets a maximum that suppliers can charge per unit of energy, and caps the level of profits an energy supplier can make to 1.9%. Ofgem are responsible for setting the energy price cap. You can find out more here: 
https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/publications/ofgem-confirms-changes-price-cap-methodology-and-frequency-ahead-new-rate-be-announced-later-month

You can find out more about the Government's Energy profits tax here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/cost-of-living-support/energy-profits-levy-factsheet-26-may-2022

You can find out more about nationalisation and how it works in this House of Commons Library note: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/research-briefings/cbp-8325/

You can find out more about energy prices including support available and how and why energy prices are changing in this House of Commons Library note: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/research-briefings/cbp-9491/

attributes.action: Suspend lifting of energy price cap, whilst companies report record profits.
attributes.background:
Ofgem are a government department, responsible for the lifting of (or not) energy prices caps and the regulation of the energy industry. 
Whilst the nation struggles with day to day costs, inflation rising, and stagnant wages, energy firms report record breaking profits, whilst we suffer.
attributes.additional_details:
Ofgem are a government department, responsible for the lifting of (or not) energy prices caps and the regulation of the energy industry. 
Whilst the nation struggles with day to day costs, inflation rising, and stagnant wages, energy firms report record breaking profits, whilst we suffer. 
We demand the government put a freeze on raising the price cap further, before millions of families fall into fuel poverty, debt and ill health, all for the sake of lining shareholders pockets.

rejection.details:
The calculation of the energy price cap is a matter for the regulator Ofgem, which is operationally independent of the UK Government and House of Commons. You can find out more about how the price cap is calculated here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/information-consumers/energy-advice-households/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Introduce a "Triple lock" to restrict energy cap increases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621347

Reform energy pricing and taxes to better protect lower income households: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621407

Subsidise a 'basic' amount of electricity for households: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616915

attributes.action: Introduce Nutrition as an additional compulsory subject from KS1 - KS4.
attributes.background: Offer similar learning hours as the 3 core subjects, to learn about Nutrition; ingredients, where they originate from, the export/import process, recipes, health benefits and drawbacks, preservatives, chemical processes, growing crops locally and globally, nutritional content and energy balance.
attributes.additional_details: Provides standardised knowledge, that benefits all children who may not receive such education from caregivers. It should have long-term mental & physical health benefits that shapes overall quality of life into adulthood. Possible obesity prevention for children and future adults. Improves likelihood of adopting professional diet centric healthcare advise as an adult, if nutrition knowledge is deeply rooted. Helps to build a defence mechanism against the adverse effects of unregulated diet culture.

attributes.action: Abolish the standing charges on Electricity and Gas supply to homes
attributes.background: Force energy suppliers to abolish standing charges on domestic energy accounts
attributes.additional_details:
These charges are unfair and create energy poverty for people who are struggling with the decision wether to heat or eat. 
  Householders are now paying up to 90p per day for just having a connection, regardless wether it’s even switched on at the mains. 
  This cannot be justified and must be stopped.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about standing charges are a matter for utility providers and Ofgem, not the UK Government or Parliament.

The price cap is a cap on a unit of gas and electricity, with standing charges taken into account. Find out more about the energy price cap, including how it includes standing charges, here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you

attributes.action: Set minimum export price for electricity under the Smart Export Guarantee
attributes.background: Set minimum export price for energy companies purchasing electricity under the SEG tariff to be at least 25% of the import price for customers
attributes.additional_details: Prior to the current energy crisis the price per kw for electricity was approx. 18p plus a standing charge of 20p per day. Now it's 27p per kw plus 50p standing charge and this is due to increase again by October. Yet the export price under the Smart Export Guarantee has dropped from an average of 6p per kw to 3p. I believe this to be an unfair disparity and request the government step in to regulate to ensure fair prices and to encourage home owners to purchase renewables.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/613896

attributes.action: A Royal Commission to report within 18 month on coastal defence and tidal power
attributes.background: A Severn Barrage can green South Wales steel and supply huge quantities of energy adjacent to market while defending the coast from sea rise and tidal surges:secure indigenous energy sovereignty against global price/currency fluctuation simultaneously initiate lagoons for Liverpool Swansea Cumbria.
attributes.additional_details: Tidal power is a simple proven technology with out the extreme risks re terrorism of nuclear power which is delegating irradiated waste for 100,000 years with no safe storage options identified by Government and with Windscale/Sellafield clear up approaching 100 billion in cost ; tidal has to be the option at scale balancing the east coast wind factory with long term predictable industrial quantities of power; modern turbines generate almost continuously and intermittency issues are resolved .

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

It's not clear if you want the Government to create a royal commission to develop a tidal energy strategy, or if you just want the Government to invest in tidal energy.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Require LPAs hold referendums on support for onshore renewables by April 2024
attributes.background: Every local planning authority (LPA) should be required to have a referendum on whether their constituents support onshore renewables, so the results can inform local plans/policy immediately, and help give certainty to energy companies wanting to deploy renewable technologies.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite an energy crisis, largely subsidy-free delivery, public opinion polls showing support, debunking of health concerns and noise reduction from innovation, there is still significant resistance to onshore renewables such as wind and many councils block planning applications for onshore renewables.
 
We believe requiring referendums across the country, to gauge support for onshore renewables, should help make sure LPA policy better reflects the will of the people.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Make energy use more sustainable by making unsustainable energy more expensive.
attributes.background: If we change the prices on different types of energy, we could help people make a different choice. Make sustainable energy more mass-produced by making it cheaper, and making unsustainable energy more expensive.
attributes.additional_details: I want the Government to do it because energy pollution is a big problem and this could be a good way to solve it. If the Government do it it could be a big advantage to the country.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about sustainability of energy, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.
Decisions about the cost of energy are a matter for generators and Ofgem, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to increase taxes on generators of non-renewable energy, to make renewable energy comparatively cheaper, if that's something you'd like to happen.

attributes.action: Prohibit plans to increase Gas and Electricity Bills for households.
attributes.background: Prohibit plans to increase Gas and Electricity Bills. This has become unaffordable due to the covid pandemic. People have lost jobs, people have gained high amounts of debt. People are struggling to put food on the table. We are physically unable to pay the vast cost increase.
attributes.additional_details: We should not be 'given' £200 to put towards Energy bills and then have to repay the costs over a period of time. This is not helping. This is creating more debt for households, making more bills unaffordable.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608007

attributes.action: Enquiry and Overhaul of the National Grid Energy Tarriff System.
attributes.background: Develop two wholesale markets - one for renewable and one for brown energy and the ability for the consumer to transparently purchase this energy with a certificate of origin clearly established under the green code transparency.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK energy market (designed by civil servants, regulators, politicians and primarily Oil and Gas companies) has a single market price for electricity - from whatever source it is generated, whether that be clean renewable or gas and coal.

Renewable energy costs, wind, solar, geothermal are generally fixed provision of energy cost without too much fluctuation in operating costs as they are not dependant on feed stock such as gas, coal or fuel oil to generate the electricity.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the electricity market, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

There is not a single price for electricity, and electricity providers generate and buy electricity in a range of different ways. Your petition calls on the Government to create two wholesale markets, but it's not clear how this could be achieved.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to review and reform the electricity market, with a view to increasing transparency about how the electricity customers use is generated, if that's something you'd like to happen.

attributes.action: Show some compassion for the people working in the energy industry
attributes.background: We ask Boris Johnson to stand up in parliament and show some compassion for the the thousands of people who have lost, and who are at risk of losing their jobs as a result of the gas crisis.
attributes.additional_details: Since the gas crisis has started the focus has been on protecting customers. We do not disagree with this. But something important has been lacking. Not one politician has stood and represented the thousands of people who work in the industry, and who are at risk of losing their jobs. We ask for some compassion and to stop the rhetoric that anyone who works in the industry is incompetent. We ask Boris to say sorry for the tone of this Government and to show some humanity.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action,such as changing a law or a policy

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Give 16 year olds an I.D card Instead of using a birth certificate/passport.
attributes.background: At 16 you can buy a lottery ticket, energy drinks and cinema tickets for certain films, but without your passport or birth certificate it is difficult to prove your age. Many do not wish to carry these valuable documents with them for fear of loss or theft.
attributes.additional_details: We ask the government to give a card to everyone at the age of 16 and above, with their photo, name and D.O.B to prove their age. Passports and birth certificates are valuable and difficult to replace and a National Insurance card isn't classed as formal I.D.

attributes.action: Allow consumers to choose between water providers as we do with other services
attributes.background: Give freedom of choice to households for water as it is with energy and broadband.
attributes.additional_details: Water companies hold monopolies and there is no healthy competition or choice for customers.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban unsolicited junk mail
attributes.background: Ban the distribution of unsolicited junk mail which not only is a nuisance but a detrimental affect on the environment and waste of energy and resources, contributing to landfill. Also current systems in place for refusing this service are not fit for purpose, complicated and timely.
attributes.additional_details: Ban the unsolicited distribution of junk mail and unaddressed items to residential and commercial properties

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Impose a windfall tax on excess energy company profits
attributes.background: Many energy companies are making enormous profits from the current high price of gas, oil, and electricity. The UK should follow the example of the EU and impose a windfall tax on these companies to provide additional finance for the NHS, social care, people in poverty, etc.
attributes.additional_details: The excess profits made by energy companies are so large that they have been quoted as saying that they don't know what to do with them. They have also stated that a windfall tax would not affect their investment plans. Not imposing a windfall tax means a higher tax burden for the general population for years to come. Imposing a windfall tax would not be an impediment to growth, as has already been stated.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Increase the windfall tax on energy companies and apply it retroactively
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/623277

attributes.action: Parliament to introduce a windfall tax on energy companies
attributes.background: Its totally wrong that energy companies are making obscene amounts in profit while individuals, families and businesses suffer.  Its wrong to expect the taxpayer to foot the bill to protect the profits of the energy companies.
attributes.additional_details: Its time for the Government to put the interests of the British people first, that includes ahead of party interests etc.  It's wrong that energy companies are making billions in profit whilst so many suffer.  We, the public have had enough.  We should not have to pay more tax to protect the profits of the energy companies, the bonuses paid out and dividends paid to shareholders.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action:

Extend the windfall tax to all utility companies
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/622266

attributes.action: To extend the energy price cap to all care residences
attributes.background: From individuals to large organisations, people are concerned about how they will cover energy costs. The impact on care residences may mean hikes in weekly contributions from the elderly and infirm, or redundancy measures being imposed which would affect the quality of care provided.
attributes.additional_details: Elderly and infirm people are the most vulnerable members of our communities: I believe a society is judged by how it supports those same people. This is an opportunity for the new Cabinet to demonstrate its commitment to helping everyone. Why not start therefore with care residences?

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition, the Government has announced a new cap on prices that will also apply to businesses. You can read more here

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-announces-energy-price-guarantee-for-families-and-businesses-while-urgently-taking-action-to-reform-broken-energy-market

attributes.action: Remove energy bills from MPs allowable expenses claims
attributes.background: In view of the fact that MPs can reclaim their energy bill costs, there is no incentive for them to act in the interest of the rest of the population in keeping energy costs affordable. The right for MPs to reclaim their energy costs should be removed.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out how to contact IPSA here:

http://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/contact-us/

attributes.action: End energy standing charges
attributes.background:
End energy company standing charges to all UK homes so that people can better reduce their energy costs when faced with a heating or eating scenario.
The unit price would increase slightly but this would give the poorest the option to stop using gas completely for a given period and invite no cost.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621561

attributes.action: Ban MPs claiming expenses for second homes amid the cost of living crisis.
attributes.background: MPs are on up to £80,000 a year. MPs should NOT be able to claim their energy bills on expenses for second homes amid the cost of living crisis. Many families are struggling now and will continue to struggle as the crisis worsens and the energy price-caps continue to rise.
attributes.additional_details: MPs have charged taxpayers £420,000 for energy bills on their second homes over 3 years (according to an Open Democracy report). Energy bills are expected to rise in September/October and again in January, with bills reaching £5,000 by next April. The government have still not updated its support package to meet the cost of living crisis.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

attributes.action: It’s time for the uk Goverment to make energy companies publicly owned
attributes.background: The goverments attempt to stem the steep rise of electric and gas bills is useless. As long as these companies are owned privately with greedy shareholders who have shelf companies abroad taking every penny from uk people paying their companies crippling rates for energy ruining peoples lives.
attributes.additional_details: I want the goverment to make an energy company a public company for the uk people to own. There will be no huge shares of uk tax evasion of profit going to greedy individuals but will be reintroduced into the company to reduce energy costs for the uk people. Otherwise the uk uk will be responsible for severe poverty and the death of many people who cannot afford to heat their homes or eat. The goverment need to implement this NOW !

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608056

attributes.action: Scrap VAT on household gas, electricity, heating oil, & on the standing charge
attributes.background:
The cost of energy is set to increase again in October by another 60%, many people are already struggling to pay bills and not everyone qualifies for the uplift. 
VAT has a disproportionate effect on disabled people who rely on equipment that use electricity, & they may not qualify for PIP.
attributes.additional_details: VAT is an unfair tax, and the Govt needs to raise revenue by fair, means tested methods that do not have a disproportionate effect on disabled people.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action:  

Remove VAT on domestic energy bills now: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617418

attributes.action: Windfall tax on the companies making huge profits from the energy crisis.
attributes.background: Place a much lower cap on energy prices, as the French have done, and place a windfall tax on the energy companies and market traders making increased profits from the current crisis.
attributes.additional_details: The current energy crisis is causing misery for ordinary people who cannot afford to heat their homes or feed their families. Meanwhile huge profits are being made on the back of this current crisis. Yet there isn't any less gas or oil being produced, the crisis is a result of speculation in the market pushing up prices. The government can and should do the job they were elected for and protect the people of this country.

rejection.details:
The energy cap is set by Ofgem, which is operationally independent of the Government and Parliament.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Tax 50% of the Energy Companies profits to help households pay bills: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607983

Fund payments to energy customers to cover price rises by taxing oil companies: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608136

attributes.action: Revoke the compulsory Energy Loan
attributes.background:
Stop the government from forcing the people of the UK to borrow money to subsidise energy in greater short-term.
It is not in the public interest to borrow money they can't afford to pay back to subsidise energy price increases due to lack of storage facilities in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The government should write into the law  governing the issue of contracts to provide energy, that suppliers shall provide adequate storage to cater for predictable peaks and troughs in energy market prices to protect Consumers from excessive price rises.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608007

attributes.action: Step in and stop these ridiculous, unaffordable living costs
attributes.background: I would like the Goverment to step in and do something about this crazy overpriced cost of living. Its getting beyond manageable for most people. Everything around us keeps increasing in price yet wages never go up at the rate as the cost of living does.
attributes.additional_details: Something needs to change. A few complaints to the energy companies or fuel companies will not change anything. We need strength in numbers to force the change and make this world liveable. Having the basic amenities to live should not cost you the earth on a monthly basis. There is not much in this world right now that is bringing joy so to have to pay over the odds to be in our homes now to be warm or watch tv or travel to work to earn money to pay your gas or electric bill is crazy.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that your concerned about the increased cost of living, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do about this.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Subsidise energy prices to offset any increase in the energy price cap: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/606586

Temporarily suspend all taxes on all fuels and energy bills: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610585

Reduce fuel duty and VAT by 40% for a period of 2 years: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599089

attributes.action: Impose a windfall tax on the oil & gas industry
attributes.background: While the likes of Shell and BP make colossal profits, consumers face huge bills. The solution is morally and economically clear - impose a windfall tax on the oil & gas industry
attributes.additional_details: Over the past year the huge rise in global oil and gas prices has provided oil and gas companies with vastly expanded profits. BP has just announced 2021 profits of £9.5bn (compared with a loss of £4.2bn the year before) and Shell £14bn (a four-fold increase). If these additional profits were taxed, the revenues could be used to help reduce energy bills for hard-pressed consumers.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Tax 50% of the Energy Companies profits to help households pay bills: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607983

Fund payments to energy customers to cover price rises by taxing oil companies: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608136

attributes.action: Reduce fuel poverty by Increasing tax on oil companies instead of forcing loans
attributes.background:
In the energy cap rise, average household bills will rise by over £700 which is double. Current plans to make every household take a £200 loan repayable over 5 years aren't a solution and taking the sting out of it, isn't good enough.

Increase taxes at the source i.e. the big oil companies
attributes.additional_details: Other countries aren't experiencing anywhere near the amount of raise in consumer prices, so we shouldn't either. Its going to have a detrimental effect on millions of households throughout the UK and will become the next crisis.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607983

attributes.action: Cut tax on household energy bills
attributes.background: Remove VAT on household fuel bills to counteract the hike in gas prices  which is causing fuel poverty.
attributes.additional_details: The steep increase in prices of gas is causing domestic energy bills to significantly increase which in turn is causing fuel poverty across the UK. By cutting the tax on energy bills this can support UK residents to continue to fuel their homes.

Subsidise energy prices to offset any increase in the energy price cap: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/606586

attributes.action: All energy saving products, insulation, solar panels, anything green zero vat.
attributes.background: Make all energy saving products, insulation, solar panels, ground source heat pumps, air heat pumps, anything green zero vat.
attributes.additional_details: Make all energy saving products, insulation, solar panels, ground source heat pumps, air heat pumps, anything green zero vat.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599459

attributes.action: Increase all fossil fuel price by 2% every month until 2050.
attributes.background: The UK Government must collect an increasingly higher duty on all types of fossil fuel used for all private and business uses. These extra funds must be aimed at fast-tracking sustainable and affordable green energy and support a generational transition to sustainable business practices.
attributes.additional_details: Climate change requires a drastic change in everyone's lifestyle. Fossil fuel is the main cause of it, and we need to stop using it now. Churchill famously said 'I have nothing to offer but blood, toil, tears and sweat', and without a rapid change of course we will soon face food and water scarcity and a breakdown of society as we know it. Collecting more duty from all fossil fuels will force consumers and businesses to change habits and fund a fundamental shift across the entire nation.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

The Government is responsible for setting duties on fuel and other fossil fuel products, but decisions about prices for these products are a matter for manufacturers and retailers, not the Government or Parliament.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

We could accept a petition calling for changes to duties on fuel and other fossil fuel products, if that's what you want to happen.

attributes.action: A Referendum on the Green Revolution
attributes.background:
I want parliamentary debates on the best way to achieve our Green goals.
I want transparency and most of all I want the people to choose for themselves. For the people by the people
attributes.additional_details: Set up debates on Green energy, on electrification, on nature reserves and on Green jobs to look after our environment.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about public input to proposals to achieve environmental goals, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Hold a referendum on whether to keep the 2050 net zero target: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599602

attributes.action: Fit all new build houses with renewable energy devices.
attributes.background: To make all new build homes suitable for a more eco freindly future, this would require all new buildings to fit or attach a minimum of 4 solar panels or a renewable energy device with an equivalent power output.
attributes.additional_details: With the environment suffering with emission control, and the all countries focusing on vehicle production becoming  all electric by 2030 it seems vital that every household should be concentrating on producing electricity to help power stations  from burning excessive fossil fuels. This seems like a great opportunity to start building a more environmentally friendly britain and start a trend all coutries should embrace.
